DataElementConcept.preferredName: Common Toxicity Criteria for Adverse Events Personality Change
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A standard terminology developed to report adverse events occurring in cancer clinical trials.  Common terminology criteria for adverse events (CTCAE) are used in study adverse event summaries and Investigational New Drug reports to the Food and Drug Administration.  The CTCAE contain a grading scale for each adverse event term representing the severity of the event._A noticeable change in a person's behavior and thinking. Causes include depression, drug or alcohol abuse, brain injuries, brain tumors, and Alzheimer's disease.

Concepts.longName: Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events

Common terminology criteria for adverse events (CTCAE) are used in study adverse event summaries and Investigational New Drug reports to the Food and Drug Administration.  The CTCAE contain a grading scale for each adverse event term representing the severity of the event.
